articles.title: European legal experts eye Poland's new law limiting judges
articles.description: WARSAW, Poland (AP) — Law experts are holding talks in Poland on a controversial draft law that would give politicians the power to fire or fine judges in defiance of Europe's principle of judicial independence.
articles.content:
WARSAW, Poland (AP) Law experts are holding talks in Poland on a controversial draft law that would give politicians the power to fire or fine judges in defiance of Europe's principle of judicial independence.

articles.title: Lebanese official says authorities have issued travel ban for fugitive ex-Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn over Interpol notice
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Lebanese official says authorities have issued travel ban for fugitive ex-Nissan chief Carlos Ghosn over Interpol notice.

articles.author: By NICOLE WINFIELD Associated Press
articles.title: Pope warns of risks from US-Iran tensions in policy speech
articles.description: VATICAN CITY (AP) — Pope Francis warned Thursday that increasing tensions between the U.S. and Iran are setting the stage for a broader conflict in the Mideast while jeopardizing efforts to rebuild Iraq.
articles.content:
VATICAN CITY (AP) Pope Francis warned Thursday that increasing tensions between the U.S. and Iran are setting the stage for a broader conflict in the Mideast while jeopardizing efforts to rebuild Iraq.

articles.author: Associated Press
articles.title: Nationwide protest in France over pensions as talks continue
articles.description: PARIS (AP) — Rail workers, teachers, doctors, lawyers and others joined a nationwide day of protests and strikes Thursday to denounce French President Emmanuel Macron's plans to overhaul the pension system.
articles.content:
PARIS (AP) Rail workers, teachers, doctors, lawyers and others joined a nationwide day of protests and strikes Thursday to denounce French President Emmanuel Macron's plans to overhaul the pension system.

articles.title: Florida man convicted of smuggling lizards from Philippines
articles.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — A Florida man pleaded guilty to his part in a trafficking scheme in which live water monitor lizards were stuffed into socks and concealed inside electronics to be smuggled from the Philippines to the United States.
articles.content:
TAMPA, Fla. (AP) A Florida man pleaded guilty to his part in a trafficking scheme in which live water monitor lizards were stuffed into socks and concealed inside electronics to be smuggled from the Philippines to the United States.

articles.title: Booker: Impeachment trial could be ‘big blow’ to my campaign
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Sen. Cory Booker said a looming impeachment trial and other pressing issues in Washington could deal a “big, big blow” to his Democratic presidential campaign by keeping him away from Iowa in the final weeks before the…

articles.title: EU's official: No-deal is more harmful for Britain than EU
articles.description: BRUSSELS (AP) — The European Union’s chief Brexit negotiator said Thursday that if Britain wants as much access as possible to the bloc's market after it leaves, it won't have unfettered freedom to subsidize its industry.
articles.content:
BRUSSELS (AP) The European Unions chief Brexit negotiator said Thursday that if Britain wants as much access as possible to the bloc's market after it leaves, it won't have unfettered freedom to subsidize its industry.

articles.title: Norway to take 600 migrants moved from Libya camps to Rwanda
articles.description: COPENHAGEN, Denmark (AP) — Norway says it will take 600 asylum seekers recently evacuated to Rwanda from Libyan detention centers as the Scandinavian country wants to stop the sometimes deadly smuggling of migrants across the Mediterranean Sea.
